result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank E Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all costs and surcharges WAIVED, due to defendant's financial situation. Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 07-28-15. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank E Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank E Hernandez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Frank E Hernandez in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for (56) day  - Time served.  
Court ordered all costs and surcharges WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation. 
Court ordered defendant pay mandatory $200.00 DNA Surcharge by 7-28-2015.   If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Frank E Hernandez not in court, in custody, not produced.    Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case held off the recrod.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 46. jks 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frank E Hernandez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Frank E Hernandez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
